text.tspan: Calculate the coordinates of a mitered offset (e) given:
1. that vertex (a) of adjoining edges A & B;
3. the change in angle (ß) between the two edges; and
4. the perpendicular offsets of a: (b) and (c)
b and c are δ multiples of the normals of precalculated
edge unit vectors. The vector (ad) is simply the sum of
the vectors ab and ac. Hence knowing ad, we need to
scale this vector so that it corresponds to vertex e.
In other words, what is the ratio of ad to ae?
Ratio of ad to ae = 1 + cos(ß)
